turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: He would have loved this.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Your father?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: All his years at sea, he never stopped talking about these islands.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You miss him.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I'd have liked to have said goodbye.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He knows.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You sound so sure.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I am about this.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: He never would have believed a woman like you existed.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Do you remember the last time you and I danced under the stars?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Guilty.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: On the deck of the Yankee, the night you asked me to marry you.  We weren't much older than they are.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You may not like what you hear.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I can take it.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: They've become what you wanted. They're a crew.  That's why he came.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Why did we begin this?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: We were idealists.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Because we believed we could make an impact out here.  Self reliance and community through the disciplines of sailing.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I haven't forgotten.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Phil, he's not looking inside.  He's just striking out at the world.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He has a lot of hurt inside him.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Well, he better learn to own it. Actions have consequences.  It's not what happens here Alice, it's what they take away with them.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What are they doing?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Claiming their place in the world.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh I was walkin' down Lime street one day...

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Hey!  Weigh!  Blow the man down...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: A pretty young maiden she happened my way...

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Give me some time to blow the man down...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: So to all you sailors who've fought wind and whale...

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Weight!  Hey!  Blow the man down...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: She said "None the better, you all go to hell..."

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Give me some time to Blow the man down!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Everyone aboard young Bill?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yes, Sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Good.  Let's go sailing.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: We'll bear off to port and run down wind.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Mr. Lawford, stand by to ease the mainsheet.  Rick, get on the jib sheet.  George, John, Philip, Tim and Dick go aloft to unstop the forecourse.  George will show you what to do.  Tod, show your men the forward pinrail and stand ready on the buntlines and clewlines. Forecourse first... work upward.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Raise the inner jib!  Raise the forestaysail!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Watch the tell-tales Chuck.  If we jibe now we'll have a lot of people in the water.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Why wasn't I made aware of this Bill?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I didn't know sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: It's your job to know.  If something goes wrong up there, the other eighteen people aboard can't be wondering if he's gonna do his job or not.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Come in.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Skipper, uh, the crew is pretty much doing group boot over the side.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Well, that's all part of it.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: We've got weather moving in from the west.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Everyone out of the rigging NOW!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Everybody down!  ON THE DOUBLE!!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Carry on.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: North, north-east.  And Dick, please make a note of our final position.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Why didn't you drop any sail?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Skipper called us out of the rigging.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: But your instinct was to lose sail?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: My instinct was to not get electrocuted.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: How old are you, son?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Fifteen.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Okay, here's the duty.  Gieg, Weathers, Lapchick, Schucart: scrape and paint.  Corry and Stricklin have the brass.  Robinson, you're the Galley slave.  March you're on chain gang with Barnes. Johnston, solo on bilge detail.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Butler, what'd I ever do to you?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You came back, Tod.  You came back.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: It didn't go over 'til I turned her starboard!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: It was an act of God for Christ's sake.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: There's still a way.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: It's me, don't you see.  Terry's right, I'm the escape hatch.  I disobeyed order.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Make us proud.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Where's Mom?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: I couldn't bring her down here until I knew you were safe.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: I thought we'd find a store, get you fixed up and then get you some lunch.  That sound good?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Why don't you go and try some of that on?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: All right.  I'm gonna wander over and look at some shoes...

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: When we were growing up I always felt like you would take care of things, that everything would be okay.  But you can't make this okay, can you?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: No, I can't.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Albatross?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Rick March.  Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Gieg, Chuck.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Look, meet us out front when you're through.  If they try to take anything away from you like Johnny Quest up there, just make a list and we'll have 'em send it down to the boat.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: What the "Bowsprit Affair"?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, Romeo here was on harbor watch and managed to sweet talk one of the local girls to have a go in the bowsprit.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: She isn't that old.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I mean she looks pretty damn good in her all-together for being thirty.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I walked in on my parents one time. It was only like eight o'clock and they were in bed and I thought that was kinda weird so I just walked in.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's what they get for not locking the door.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: So I'm standing there and you could hear a pin drop.  No breathing or snoring... Suddenly it hits me that somethin' was goin' on that just stopped, really fast, like people are holding their breath.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: My old man split along time ago.  It doesn't mean anything.  You just take care of number one that's all that matters.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Where you going?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: To take a piss.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, that's right.  You wanna come in and shake it for me?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: If you're gonna cheat, you might as well copy off somebody who's gonna get the answer right.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You've gotta be kidding.  Get the fuck outta my way!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I cheated to get on the boat!!!  All right?!

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I doctored my grades so I'd make the cut.  I'm a moron, okay?  You satisfied?!

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You're not a moron.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wanna bet?  Takes me half a day to get through one chapter of Lawford and I still don't have any idea what the hell he's talkin' about.  You know why it takes me so long to write papers?  because I can't spell.  While everybody else is sleeping, I'm in the rack with a flashlight and a dictionary.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: They were gonna put me into special- ed this year.  I stole a copy of my transcript, changed all the grades. Shit, who am I kidding.  I'll never pass the boards.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Listen, you don't cheat, and we'll make sure you get the grades.  We'll start a private study group.  Nobody knows.  You'll ace that test.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Bregitta.  Do you believe it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Believe what?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Her name.  Bregitta.  It's poetry.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.  How'd you do.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Ninety-six.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It's a ninety-one!  It's an 'A'!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You know?  Then why are you up here looking like you're about to jump overboard?!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I just can't believe it.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: This is your moment, don't you see? The instant when you know that your life is never going to be the same again.  When you stand up and are counted.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I couldn't have done it without you.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yes you could.  You did.  This is all you.  Nobody else.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Feels different doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: That we're going back.  I don't want it to end.  I don't want to be what I was when I left.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Anonymous.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I've been getting ninety-sixes my whole life.  It's what they expect. After all this, I still haven't figured it out.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Figured what out?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Who I am, outside of this boat. What the hell I'm doing here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'll tell you who you are.  You're the glue.  You're the thing that holds everybody around you together. You're strong, you listen and you see things in people the rest of us can't.  It's a gift.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You know, I never had friends like this.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Me either.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I feel like... we can do anything.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You gonna jump?  Or are you just having a last look?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I was just thinking that I never had a new pair of shoes till I was twelve.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's no my fault I was born first. Besides, nobody ever sent me on an eight month vacation, so ease up on the sad sack stuff.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It's not a vacation, it's private school.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I thought this was your dream come true.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: That's not why he's sending me.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why then.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Because it looks good.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I'm just not like you.  Ya know? I'm never going to go to Yale.  I'm never going to be "William".

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Nobody says you have to be like me.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: He does.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You don't give him enough credit Chas.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Hey, shut up will ya?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It was a bad dream...

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: God damn it man.  I think he broke my nose!

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Shut up, Phil.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yeah, but how are you supposed to make the first move?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Like this!

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Why'd you do it?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: What's the difference?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You only hurt yourself you know?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Like you really care.  Like any of you give a shit what happens to me.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Can we talk?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Everybody's saying this whole tribunal is happening because of your father.  Because of you.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Well that's just typical isn't it?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Is it true Phil?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I gotta go.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You weren't there, you don't know what happened.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I know enough.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Sorry to here it.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Well, and it's pretty cool too, ya know?  Bein' here together an all...

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Listen man, I think I have a problem.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: We all have problems.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: I'm pissin' fire man.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You taking the order wouldn't have changed anything.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: They don't know that.  We were the only one's on deck. Look, there's nothing they can do to me right?  I'm a kid.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: But that's not the point...

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: That is the point... And Skipper'll slip off the hook.

turns.speaker: MIDDY
turns.text: Honey, did you know that the Albatross was captured by the Germans during World War II?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: No, I didn't.

turns.speaker: MIDDY
turns.text: It says she was originally Schooner rigged, but Captain Sheldrake turned her into a brigantine.  I think square rigs look so much more romantic.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: MIDDY
turns.text: Do you have your ticket?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MIDDY
turns.text: Passport?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Look, I just better go.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Goodbye Mom.  I'll be okay.

turns.speaker: MIDDY
turns.text: I know you will.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What the hell is going on?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Maybe it's an air raid.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can't watch this.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: How ya doing?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Look, I appreciate, you know, the concern and all, but like he said, I can take care of myself.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I just brought you something to eat.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I feel like I got you into this.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I'm used to spending a lot of time alone.  I guess that's what I thought it would be out here.  But, it's not is it?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'm sorry I left you hanging up there.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It doesn't matter.  Really.  I'm just sorry you got chewed out.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You think Skipper and Alice do it?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Ya know... "It".

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: That's like wondering if your mom and dad do it.  Who wants to know?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: No way!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Come on man, what'd they look like?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: So... What happened?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: My mother says in this really low, but very awake kind of voice "What?"

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What'd you do?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I said "Sorry, wrong room" and walked away.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: My parents don't do it anymore.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: How do you know?  They might.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: 'Cause they're getting a divorce.  That's why they sent me here.  My sister's at Tabor.  They just wanted us out of the house so they could get down to business.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Where are you from any way?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Depths of hell... Ohio.  How 'bout you?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Kennet Square, PA.  'Mushroom capital of the world'.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It was so real...

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Here's the thing; whenever you're having a nightmare, all you have to do is say 1-2-3 wake up!  You'll be out of it.  You'll wake up.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Who told you that?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: My dad.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It works?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Swear to God.  Only good advice he ever gave me.  Now, go back to sleep.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: That's how he died you know.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: My brother.  He fell out of the old beech tree.  Broke his neck.  I was on a camp out.  They started going at it, throwin' things, a real knock down...  They didn't find him 'till the next morning.  They didn't even know why he was up there.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Jesus, you never told them?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I couldn't.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: What are they doing?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can't make it out?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can't go in there.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: What are you talking about.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Hold her steady into the wind. Southwest by west.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Gentleman, when you hear an order, sing out.  I want to know that you've heard and understand.  Raise the mainsail.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Ah... Northeast... sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Speak up boy!

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Northeast sir!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Unfurl the squares!

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: All stop on the engine.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It was my fault.  I slipped.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Remember something, sooner or later... we all have to face it.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Face what?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Uh, huh.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Would you, um, say it's a big storm?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Sometimes it gets exciting out here.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Shouldn't we turn away?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You can't run from the wind son. You trim your sails, face the music and let the chips fall.  Bill, let's close her up, dog, tight.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: What's on your mind?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I'm here on behalf of the crew, sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Well, spit it out.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: The fact is... We'd like you to give Phil another chance.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Can't do it.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Sir...?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Close the door.  Sit down.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Why do you think I'm sending him home?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: He killed the dolphin.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: The Dolphin was a symptom.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Of what?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Of a fight he can't win out here.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It's his father sir.  He's suffocating him.  We've all seen it...

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I mean he has all these expectations and he doesn't even know who his own kid is.  What right did then have to show up here?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: They have every right Chuck.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: They send us because they want us to change, or grow up or something and then they try to keep us the same.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Does Phil know how you guys feel?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You should tell him.  That's something he can take with him.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: Chicken is a fool's game captain.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: So is violating international law.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: But you invited is aboard.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Your cannons made a compelling argument.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: Stow away?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: He left his passport in Curacao. It's being mailed to Panama.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: That is unfortunate.  We'll have to take him with us.

turns.speaker: DOWNING
turns.text: Why didn't you turn hard to port as the wind hit?

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: I thought we'd have a better chance if I headed into the wind so we could spill air from our sails.

turns.speaker: DOWNING
turns.text: But the Captain ordered you hard to starboard.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Twice.

turns.speaker: DOWNING
turns.text: Is that what you were trained to do?

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOWNING
turns.text: Then what do you think he was trying to do.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Let the blow drive the boat down wind.  Neutralize our canvas.

turns.speaker: DOWNING
turns.text: So when the captain gave you an order contrary to your training, you thought he was making a mistake?

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Albatross?  Doesn't inspire a lot of confidence.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Oh, on the contrary, the Albatross is considered a very good omen.  It is said they embody the spirits of sailors passed on.  It's very bad luck if you kill one.  And dolphins too.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: I'm Francis Boutillier.  This is my son, Philip.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Your cable said you wouldn't be putting out until mid-October.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: As you can see, there's a lot to do.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Indentured servitude is not what my son had in mind.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: This is a working ship.  Promptness is not a luxury, it's a necessity, as is the work to maintain her.  Had we been ready, I can assure you we would have sailed.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: And I would have expected compensation for my time and expense coming all the way down here.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Happily, it all worked out... This time.  Bill, take Philip below and help him find a bunk.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: I'll be frank with you.  This was his mother's idea.  A romp through the Caribbean on a sailboat sounds more like a vacation than an education if you ask me.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: It will be more than that, I can promise you.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Take good care of my son.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: We'll do our best.  You're welcome to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: He's a big boy.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Well, we thought we'd drop in and see if you were all still in one piece.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: And, of course, we are.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Well, you never can tell these days, can you?
